Name: Knickerbocker
Ingredients: 75 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
Instructions: SHAKE first all ingredients with ice and strain into glass 2/3rd filled with cubed ice. Cap with crushed ice, serve with a straw.
Review: Fruity and refreshing – a party drink with rum and raspberry flavours predominating. At its best when made with homemade raspberry syrup.
History: The Knickerbocker cocktail first appears in Jerry Thomas' 1862 The Bartender's Guide . For the full story see our Knickerbocker Cocktails page.
Nutrition: One serving of Knickerbocker contains 231 calories
Garnish: Squeezed-out half lime shell & seasonal berries: raspberries, blackberries, blueberries
